name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.printers.AllowForUsers
policyDescription: Allows a printer for users in a given organization.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of printer as visible in Admin SDK printers API.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a printer is allowed for users in a given organization.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.printers.AllowForDevices
policyDescription: Allows a printer for devices in a given organization.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of printer as visible in Admin SDK printers API.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a printer is allowed for devices in a given organization.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.printers.AllowForManagedGuest
policyDescription: Allows a printer for Managed Guest in a given organization.

additionalTargetKeyNames.keyDescription: Id of printer as visible in Admin SDK printers API.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether a printer is for Managed Guest in a given organization.
Maximum session length. 1 - 1440 minutes; leave empty for unlimited sessions.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Duration policy field value is in the range [1, 1440] (unit in minute).

fieldDescriptions.description: Uploaded file can be one of the MIME types: [image/jpeg], and file size cannot exceed 512kb.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The URI can be obtained by uploading your file via the upload service.

fieldDescriptions.description: Uploaded file can be one of the MIME types: [image/jpeg], and file size cannot exceed 16384kb.

nestedFieldDescriptions.description: The URI can be obtained by uploading your file via the upload service.

fieldDescriptions.description: Hex color. Enter a valid hex color, for instance #FFFFFF.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Disable browser sign-in.
Enable browser sign-in.
Force users to sign-in to use the browser.

fieldDescriptions.description: Pattern. A regular expression which is used to determine which Google accounts can be set as browser primary accounts in Google Chrome (i.e. the account that is chosen during the Sync opt-in flow). For example, the value .*@example.com would restrict sign in to accounts in the example.com domain.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable signin interception.
Disable signin interception.
Show the display password button on the login and lock screen.
Do not show the display password button on the login and lock screen.
Apply supported user settings to Chrome on Android.
Do not apply supported user settings to Chrome on Android.
Place Chrome device in user organization.
Keep Chrome device in current location.

notices.noticeMessage: Placing a device in a user organization during manual enrollment will give the Chrome device the device-level policies set for that organizational unit, such as settings for Cloud Print, Networks, Kiosk, and Sign-in Restrictions. Learn More About Device Settings at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678. If you choose to not enable this policy, devices will appear in the top-level organization when you enroll them. Devices can later be moved manually in the Admin Console or by changing the orgUnitPath with the API. Learn More About Enrollment at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1360534.

fieldDescriptions.description: Populate asset ID and location fields during enrollment.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Users in this organization can provide asset ID and location during enrollment.
Do not allow for users in this organization.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allow users in this OU to enroll existing devices. Enrollment permissions will only take effect on devices that have been configured to re-enroll with manual credential entry. Learn more at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/1375678.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users in this organization to enroll new or re-enroll existing devices.
Only allow users in this organization to re-enroll existing devices (cannot enroll new or deprovisioned devices).
Do not allow users in this organization to enroll new or re-enroll existing devices.
Allow users to end processes with the Chrome task manager.
Block users from ending processes with the Chrome task manager.

fieldDescriptions.description: Isolated site origins. Enter a list of origins to isolate, for instance https://mail.com or https://login.example.com. One pattern per line.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Turn on site isolation for all websites.
Turn off site isolation for all websites, except those set in 'isolateOrigins'.
Allow user to choose to enable site isolation.
Turn on site isolation for all websites.
Turn off site isolation for all websites, except those set in 'isolateOriginsAndroid'.

fieldDescriptions.description: Isolated site origins (Android). Enter a list of origins to isolate, for instance https://mail.com or https://login.example.com. One pattern per line.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow the user to decide.
Always allow use of password manager.
Never allow use of password manager.
Allow locking screen.
Do not allow locking screen.

notices.noticeMessage: Lock screen is disabled. If any setting under 'chrome.users.IdleSettings' would result in locking the screen, the device will instead log out.

knownValueDescriptions.description: PIN.
Fingerprint.
Enable PIN auto-submit on the lock and login screen.
Disable PIN auto-submit on the lock and login screen.
Allow users to play media when the device is locked.
Do not allow users to play media when the device is locked .

fieldDescriptions.description: Idle time in minutes. Leave empty for system default.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Sleep.
Logout.
Lock Screen.
Sleep.
Logout.
Allow user to configure.
Lock screen.
Don't lock screen.
Allow incognito mode.
Disallow incognito mode.
Never save browser history.
Always save browser history.
Allow clearing history in settings menu.
Do not allow clearing history in settings menu.

fieldDescriptions.description: Erase local data when the browser is closed.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Erase all local user data.
Do not erase local user data.

notices.noticeMessage: If you turn on ephemeral mode, we strongly recommend that you set the 'chrome.users.appsconfig.AndroidAppsEnabled' setting to 'arcEnabled=false'. Otherwise, session startup is significantly impacted. For details, read the best practices guide at https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/9962839.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Perform online OCSP/CRL checks.
Do not perform online OCSP/CRL checks.
Allow sites to detect users' geolocation.
Do not allow sites to detect users' geolocation.
Always ask the user if a site wants to detect their geolocation.
Allow the user to decide.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.SingleSignOn

fieldDescriptions.description: SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome OS devices. Please set up SSO for Google Workspace before using this policy: https://support.google.com/a/answer/60224.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome devices.
Disable SAML-based single sign-on for Chrome devices.

accessRestrictions: You must have Google Workspace SSO enabled for your domain in order to control this policy.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.SingleSignOnLoginFrequency

fieldDescriptions.description: Force online login flow for SAML-based single sign-on accounts. Please set up SSO for Google Workspace and activate single sign-on for Chrome device users before using this policy: https://support.google.com/a/answer/60224.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Every day.
Every 3 days.
Every week.
Every 2 weeks.
Every 3 weeks.
Every 4 weeks.
Every Time.
Never.

accessRestrictions: You must have Google Workspace SSO enabled for your domain in order to control this policy.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed certificate transparency URLs. Any URL listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. Enter one URL per line. Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForUrls.

Certificate transparency CA allowlist. Any subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. These hashes must be listed in a particular format. Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForCas.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be prefixed with "sha256/".

fieldDescriptions.description: Certificate transparency legacy CA allowlist. Any subjectPublicKeyInfo hashes listed will be exempt from Certificate Transparency enforcement. These hashes must be listed in a particular format and must match a recognized Legacy Certificate Authority. Enter Learn more at https://cloud.google.com/docs/chrome-enterprise/policies/?policy=CertificateTransparencyEnforcementDisabledForLegacyCas.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be prefixed with "sha256/".

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.CaCertificateManagementAllowed
policyDescription: User management of installed CA certificates.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users to manage all certificates.
Allow users to manage user certificates.
Disallow users from managing certificates.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.ClientCertificateManagementAllowed
policyDescription: User management of installed client certificates.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users to manage all certificates.
Allow users to manage user certificates.
Disallow users from managing certificates.

fieldDescriptions.description: Controls whether Intel Hyper-Threading technology is disabled, or if all cores can be used without restrictions.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow the user to decide.
Optimize for stability.
Optimize for performance.
Renderer code integrity enabled.
Renderer code integrity disabled.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.PasswordLeakDetection
policyDescription: Enable leak detection for entered credentials.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow the user to decide.
Enable Leak detection for entered credentials.
Disable Leak detection for entered credentials.
No policy set.
Enable in regular sessions only.
Enable in regular and incognito sessions.
Enable in regular and guest sessions.
Enable in regular, incognito and guest sessions.
Allow Chrome Cleanup to periodically scan the system and allow manual scans.
Prevent Chrome Cleanup from periodical scans and disallow manual scans.
Users may choose to share results from a Chrome Cleanup cleanup run with Google.
Results from a Chrome Cleanup cleanup are always shared with Google.
Results from a Chrome Cleanup cleanup are never shared with Google.
Prevent third party code from being injected into Chrome.
Allow third party code to be injected into Chrome.
Use the default configuration for the audio sandbox.
Always sandbox the audio process.
Never sandbox the audio process.
Suppress warnings when Chrome is running on an unsupported system.
Allow Chrome to display warnings when running on an unsupported system.
Users enrolled in the Advanced Protection program will receive extra protections.
Users enrolled in the Advanced Protection program will only receive standard consumer protections.

fieldDescriptions.description: Origin or hostname patterns to ignore insecure origins security restrictions.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Show security warnings when potentially dangerous command-line flags are used.
Hide security warnings when potentially dangerous command-line flags are used.
Block popups opened with a target of _blank from interacting with the page that opened the popup.
Allow popups opened with a target of _blank to interact with the page that opened the popup.

fieldDescriptions.description: Action on security token removal (e.g. smart card).

knownValueDescriptions.description: Nothing.
Log the user out.
Lock the current session.

fieldDescriptions.description: Removal notification duration (seconds). A notification informing the user of the impending action is displayed for this many seconds.  This notification is blocking the screen.  The action will only happen after this notification expires.  The user can prevent the action by re-inserting the security token before the notification expires.  Set to 0 to disable the notification and have the action happen immediately.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Duration policy field value is in the range [0, 9999] (unit in second).

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow system notifications to be used.
Do not allow system notifications to be used.

fieldDescriptions.description: Remote access client domain. Configure the required domain names for remote access clients (one domain per line).
Remote access host domain. Configure the required domain names for remote access hosts (one domain per line).
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be formatted in domain name.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable firewall traversal.
Disable firewall traversal.
Enable the use of relay servers.
Disable the use of relay servers.

fieldDescriptions.description: UDP port range. Format: minimum-maximum (e.g. 12400-12409). If unset, any port may be used.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Show logout button in tray.
Do not show logout button in tray.
Disable Kerberos.
Enable Kerberos.

fieldDescriptions.description: Principal name. Define a Kerberos account to be added on behalf of user. The following placeholders are supported: - ${LOGIN_ID}: Username part of principal, e.g. "user" if the user logs in as "user@REALM"- ${LOGIN_EMAIL}: Full principal, e.g. "user@REALM" if the user logs in as "user@REALM".

knownValueDescriptions.description: Do not automatically add a Kerberos account.
Automatically add a Kerberos account.
Use default Kerberos configuration.
Customize Kerberos configuration.
Allow users to remember Kerberos passwords.
Do not allow users to remember Kerberos passwords.
Allow users to add Kerberos accounts.
Do not allow users to add Kerberos accounts.
Allow user to configure.
Never use a proxy.
Always auto detect the proxy.
Always use the proxy specified in 'simpleProxyServerUrl'.
Always use the proxy auto-config specified in 'simpleProxyPacUrl'.

fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The string field should be formatted in url, and should have minimum length of 1.

fieldDescriptions.description: Proxy server auto configuration file URL. URL of the .pac file that should be used for network connections.
URLs which bypass the proxy, one per line.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Ignore policies for captive portal pages.
Keep policies for captive portal pages.

fieldDescriptions.description: Supported authentication schemes. Specifies which HTTP authentication schemes are supported by Google Chrome. The default uses all four schemes.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Basic.
Digest.
NTLM.
Negotiate.
Basic authentication scheme is allowed on HTTP connections.
HTTPS is required to use Basic authentication scheme.
Enable NTLMv2 authentication.
Disable NTLMv2 authentication.
TLS 1.0.
TLS 1.1.
TLS 1.2.
SSL3.

notices.noticeMessage: Only valid for Chrome 39 to Chrome 43.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow users to click through SSL warnings and proceed to the page.
Block users from clicking through SSL warnings.

fieldDescriptions.description: Domains that allow clicking through SSL warnings. Enter a list of domain names, one per line.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: Each string field in the list should be formatted in domain name.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow the user to decide.
Always enable data compression proxy.
Always disable data compression proxy.

fieldDescriptions.description: Whether to restrict the use of UDP to a specified port range.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow WebRTC to pick any UDP port (1024-65535).
Specify range of UDP ports allowed for WebRTC.

fieldDescriptions.description: Minimum value for allowed UDP ports. This setting can only be set after setting web_rtc_udp_ports_enabled = true.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to zero.

fieldDescriptions.description: Maximum value for allowed UDP ports. This setting can only be set after setting web_rtc_udp_ports_enabled = true.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to zero.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.WebRtcLocalIpsAllowedUrls
policyDescription: WebRTC ICE candidate URLs for local IPs.

fieldDescriptions.description: URLs for which local IPs are exposed in WebRTC ICE candidates. . Patterns in this list will be matched against the security origin of the requesting URL. If a match is found the local IP addresses are shown in WebRTC ICE candidates. Otherwise, local IP addresses are concealed with mDNS hostnames. Please note that this policy weakens the protection of local IPs if needed by administrators. .

knownValueDescriptions.description: Enable.
Disable.
WebRTC will use all available interfaces when searching for the best path.
WebRTC will only use the interface connecting to the public Internet, but may connect using private IP addresses.
WebRTC will only use the interface connecting to the public Internet, and will not connect using private IP addresses.
WebRTC will use TCP on the public-facing interface, and will only use UDP if supported by a configured proxy.
Disable DNS-over-HTTPS.
Enable DNS-over-HTTPS with insecure fallback.
Enable DNS-over-HTTPS without insecure fallback.
May send DNS-over-HTTPS requests to user's configured custom name server.

fieldDescriptions.description: DNS-over-HTTPS templates. URI templates of desired DNS-over-HTTPS resolvers. If the URI template contains a '{?dns}' variable, requests to the resolver will use GET; otherwise requests will use POST.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Use the built-in DNS client on macOS, Android and Chrome OS. Allow the user to change the setting.
Always use the built-in DNS client if available.
Never use the built-in DNS client.

fieldDescriptions.description: Activate Always-on VPN for all user traffic with an app from a list of force installed Android VPN apps. Please make sure the configured app is force installed.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Allow user to disconnect from a VPN manually (VPN will reconnect on log in).
Do not allow user to disconnect from a VPN manually.

fieldDescriptions.description: Allowed authentication servers. Enter a list of servers for integrated authentication, one per line.
Allowed servers for delegation. Enter a list of servers that Chrome may delegate to for Kerberos authentication, one per line.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Respect KDC policy.
Ignore KDC policy.
Use original name entered.
Use canonical DNS name.
Include non-standard port.
Do not include non-standard port.
Allow cross-origin authentication.
Block cross-origin authentication.
Allow sites that are not cross-origin isolated to use SharedArrayBuffers.
Prevent sites that are not cross-origin isolated from using SharedArrayBuffers.
Allow User-Agent client hints.
Disable User-Agent client hints.
Accept web content served as Signed HTTP Exchanges.
Prevent Signed HTTP Exchanges from loading.
HTTP authentication credentials entered in the context of one site will automatically be used in the context of another.
HTTP authentication credentials are scoped to top-level sites.

notices.noticeMessage: Enabling this policy leaves sites open to some types of cross-site attacks and can allow users to be tracked across sites. This policy is intended to allow legacy login procedures to continue to work, but it will be removed from a future release of Chrome.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.RequireOnlineRevocationChecksForLocalAnchors
policyDescription: Require online OCSP/CRL checks for local trust anchors.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Perform revocation checking for successfully validated server certificates signed by locally installed CA certificates.
Use existing online revocation-checking settings.

fieldDescriptions.description: Maximium number of concurrent connections to the proxy server. Specifies the maximal number of simultaneous connections to the proxy server. The value of this policy should be lower than 100 and higher than 6 and the default value is 32.
fieldDescriptions.inputConstraint: The long field should have value greater than or equal to 7, and should have value less than or equal to 99.

fieldDescriptions.description: Library name or full path. Specify which GSSAPI library to use for HTTP authentication. You can set either just a library name, or a full path. Leave empty for default.
List of hostnames that will bypass the HSTS policy check . Enter a list of hostnames that will be exempt from the HSTS policy check, one per line.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.AuthAndroidNegotiateAccountType
policyDescription: Account type for HTTP Negotiate authentication.

fieldDescriptions.description: Account type. Specifies the account type of the accounts provided by the Android authentication app that supports HTTP Negotiate authentication. If no setting is provided, HTTP Negotiate authentication is disabled on Android.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Perform DNS interception checks.
Do not perform DNS interception checks.
Use default browser behavior.
Disable DNS interception checks and did-you-mean "http://intranetsite/" infobars.
Disable DNS interception checks; allow did-you-mean "http://intranetsite/" infobars.
Allow DNS interception checks and did-you-mean "http://intranetsite/" infobars.
Enable WebRTC peer connections downgrading to obsolete versions of the TLS/DTLS (DTLS 1.0, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1) protocols.
Disable WebRTC peer connections downgrading to obsolete versions of the TLS/DTLS (DTLS 1.0, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1) protocols.
Enable Web Proxy Auto-Discovery (WPAD) optimization.
Disable Web Proxy Auto-Discovery (WPAD) optimization.
Use login credentials for network authentication to a managed proxy.
Don't use login credentials for network authentication.
port 554 (expires 2021/10/15).
Enable default CECPQ2 rollout process.
Disable CECPQ2.

name: customers/C00qjrmdh/policySchemas/chrome.users.AndroidBackupRestoreServiceEnabled
policyDescription: Control Android backup and restore service.

fieldDescriptions.description: Easily restore user data and switch devices at any time. User backup includes app data. App data can be any data that an app has saved (based on developer settings), including potentially sensitive data such as contacts, messages, and photos. Backup data will not count toward a user's Drive storage quota.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Backup and restore disabled.
Let user decides whether to enable backup and restore.
Disable location services for Android apps in Chrome OS.
Allow the user to decide whether an Android app in Chrome OS can use location services.

fieldDescriptions.description: Synchronize Google Chrome OS certificates to Android apps.

knownValueDescriptions.description: Disable usage of Chrome OS CA Certificates in Android apps.
Enable usage of Chrome OS CA Certificates in Android apps.
Allow the user to decide.
Always show "Home" button.
Never show "Home" button.
